questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You are the Azure administrator for a company. The company uses only Platform as a Service (PaaS).
You need to identify which solution components Microsoft must manage and which solution components your IT staff must manage.
Match each management owner to its component. To answer, drag the responsible party from the column on the left to its component on the right. Each party may be used once, more than once, or not at all.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

discussion.content: Answer provided is correct; you manage the data and applications in PaaS

Applications (Aplicativos): Equipe de TI
Operating systems (Sistemas operacionais): Microsoft
Storage (Armazenamento): Microsoft
Application data (Dados da aplicação): Equipe de TI
According to this Applications is a shared responsibility between IT Staff and MS.. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/security/fundamentals/shared-responsibility

discussion.content: correct
Your applications will managed by your IT staff, both the applications itself and its data
correct

discussion.content:
Iaas -Virtual MAchine
Paas- Website hosting,application developing,
SAAS- online services

It is correct.
As I understood, if the answer is similar to question number 8, should be
PaaS
LaaS
SaaS

--> Website hosting should be Paas

Website hosting (Paas): Hospedagem de site (Plataforma como Serviço - PaaS)
A virtual machine that runs Linux (IaaS): Uma máquina virtual que executa Linux (Infraestrutura como Serviço - IaaS)
Document storage that uses OneDrive for Business (SaaS): Armazenamento de documentos que utiliza o OneDrive for Business (Software como Serviço - SaaS)
Paas, Iaas, Saas

The following components can be classified as:

 Website hosting: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS) or Platform as a Service (PaaS) depending on the deployment model. IaaS if the organization is responsible for managing the operating system and middleware, and PaaS if the cloud provider manages the operating system and middleware.

 A virtual machine that runs Linux: Infrastructure as a Service (IaaS). This component would be hosted on a virtual machine in the cloud and the organization would be responsible for managing the operating system, middleware, and applications.

 Document storage that uses OneDrive for Business: Software as a Service (SaaS). This component is a cloud-based service that provides document storage and collaboration capabilities, and is fully managed by Microsoft.

Classifying components is important as it helps organizations determine the level of responsibility they have for managing the component and the level of control they have over it.

comments.content:
Sorry I got a few of the acronyms confused/typoed...

Website hosting is IaaS if you are using your VMs to host the site. If you are using webapps to host a site, it is PaaS.

One drive is considered SaaS per- https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/resources/cloud-computing-dictionary/what-is-paas/ since it is a part of O365

discussion.content:
another vague/worthless question from MS. 

Website hosting is IaaS if you are using your VMs to host the site. If you are using webapps to host a site, it is Saas.

One drive is considered IaaS per the diagram here - https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/resources/cloud-computing-dictionary/what-is-paas/

Hosting your own Linux VMs is definitely IaaS.
paas,iass,saas

Website Hosting: Means you need a machine running already with Server OS to deploy your web site, Like Apache Web Server = PaaS
VM Running Linux: Any VM means you need hardware = Iaas 
Document Storage that uses one Drive : 
two part here : 1- Doc. Storage 
2- One Drive 
- If it was for DOC. storage only, that would be = IaaS
But because they said (Uses one Drive) = Means it will use OneDrive software which is a a could APP that helps you manage storage.
so the correct answer would be = SaaS
PAAS, IAAS e SAAS

Sorry... in further reviewing, it looks like the answers should ALL be IaSS. (OR, let me know if I confused myself)

Here' why:
1. IaaS for Web hosting - Running websites using IaaS can be less expensive than traditional web hosting.
https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/overview/what-is-iaas/

2. IaaS for Virtual Machine that runs Linux - Virtual Machines (VMs) consist of infrastructure to deploy an application.
Question specifies about the VM, which is IaaS; Linux is a PaaS running on the VM:
https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/blog/infrastructure-as-a-service-series-virtual-machines-and-windows/

3. IaaS for Document STORAGE that uses OneDrive for Business - OneDrive is a cloud-based storage service where you can view, browse, upload, and share the files you saved online.
Question is regarding the Document STORAGE, which lies in IaaS; question is NOT about OneDrive which is PaaS:
https://azure.microsoft.com/en-us/overview/what-is-iaas/

Let me know if I missed the boat on this one, please.

Selected Answer: C
Just a note on Databases : While the underlying database infrastructure is managed by Azure, your IT employees are responsible for managing the data within the databases, including schema design, query optimization, and data integrity.

Selected Answer: C
In PaaS, the customer is generally responsible for the application and managing the data (e.g., structure and content), but not for the underlying infrastructure or database maintenance. In many cases, the cloud provider takes care of the database platform maintenance itself.

Answer a, storage, and answer d, operating system are both included in the platform as a service model. Database management is included in platform as a service model, however the data that fills the database is the customer's responsibility. Platform as a service is designed for application development. Therefore application and database are the responsibility of the consumer. Hopefully the actual exam question is a little more clear as to whether database means the data framework, or the actual data. If only one answer can be selected the obvious answer is c, applications.

questions.question_text:
Your company makes use of Platform as a Service (PaaS) for their Azure solution.
Which of the following options are components that your IT employees are responsible for?
